subject: How can I test async callbacks?

messageBody:
I have some code that uses async callbacks and I'd like to test them. The
problem is I don't know how to report the errors and failures that occur in
the callback to JUnit. If I don't do anything the errors print out on the
console as tracebacks, but they don't get recorded in the TestResult and its
hard to tell where they came from. Callbacks are obects with two methods:
ok() and error(). Ideally I'd like to define a TestCallback which can have
asserts and fails in it. Here's what I do now:

public void testWithData() {
m_model.getData(new Callback());
}

class Callback extends Assert implements ICallback {
public void ok(Object result) {
Data data = (Data) result;
assertNotNull(data); // If this fails
I'd like TestResult to record it.
}

public void error(Throwable t) {
fail(); // I'd like to report t back to TestResult
}
}

Any ideas?
